00078 /* used when passing an MSHR index into the cache functions, but for
00079    whatever reason there's no corresponding MSHR entry */
00080 #define NO_MSHR (-1)
00081 
00082 /* This is used for latency prediction when a load completely misses in cache
00083    and has to go off to main memory */
00084 #define BIG_LATENCY 99999
00085 
00086 #define CACHE_STAT(x) {if(!cp->frozen) {x}}
00087 
00088 #define GET_BANK(x) (((x)>>cp->bank_shift) & cp->bank_mask)
00089 #define GET_MSHR_BANK(x) (((x)>>cp->bank_shift) & cp->MSHR_mask)
00090 
00091 /* CACHE_WRITEBACK is the same as CACHE_WRITE, except that CACHE_WRITEBACK does
00092    not cause the cache's replacement information/state to get updated. */
00093 enum cache_command { CACHE_NOP, CACHE_READ, CACHE_WRITE, CACHE_WRITEBACK, CACHE_PREFETCH, REFRESH };
00094 enum repl_policy_t { REPLACE_LRU, REPLACE_MRU, REPLACE_RANDOM, REPLACE_NMRU, REPLACE_PLRU, REPLACE_CLOCK };
00095 enum alloc_policy_t { WRITE_ALLOC, NO_WRITE_ALLOC };
00096 enum write_policy_t { WRITE_THROUGH, WRITE_BACK };
00097 enum read_only_t { CACHE_READWRITE, CACHE_READONLY };
00098 enum 
00099 
00100 enum PF_state_t { PF_REFRAIN, PF_OK };
00101 
00102 struct cache_line_t {
00103   md_paddr_t tag;
00104   struct core_t * core; /* originating core */
00105   int way; /* which physical column/way am I in? */
00106   qword_t meta; /* additional field for replacment policy meta data */
00107   bool valid;
00108   enum coherence_state c_state;
00109   bool dirty;
00110   bool victim;
00111   bool prefetched;
00112   bool prefetch_used;
00113   struct cache_line_t * next;
00114 };
00115 
00116 struct cache_action_t {
00117   struct core_t * core; /* originating core */
00118   void * op;
00119   seq_t action_id;
00120   md_addr_t PC;
00121   md_paddr_t paddr;
00122   int MSHR_bank;
00123   int MSHR_index;
00124   bool miss_cb_invoked;
00125   enum cache_command cmd;
00126   struct cache_t * prev_cp;
00127   /* final call back on service-complete */
00128   void (*cb)(void * op); /* NULL = invalid/empty entry */
00129   /* callback on a miss, e.g., for speculative scheduling snatchback/replay */
00130   void (*miss_cb)(void * op, int expected_latency);
00131   bool (*translated_cb)(void * op, seq_t); /* returns true if TLB translation has completed */
00132   /* extract action_id; varies depending on whether we're dealing with a uop or IFQ entry */
00133   seq_t (*get_action_id)(void *);
00134   tick_t when_enqueued; /* primarily for MSHR's; used to provide FIFO scheduling */
00135   tick_t when_started;  /* primarily for MSHR's; set to TICK_T_MAX if in need of service */
00136   tick_t when_returned; /* primarily for MSHR's; set when value returned from higher level */
00137   tick_t pipe_exit_time; /* for tracking access latency */
00138   struct cache_action_t * MSHR_link; /* used for coalescing multiple MSHR requests to same addr */
00139   bool MSHR_linked; /* true if linked to earlier MSHR request */
00140 };
00141 
00142 struct cache_fill_t {
00143   int valid;
00144   md_paddr_t paddr;
00145   enum cache_command cmd;
00146   tick_t pipe_exit_time;
00147   struct core_t * core;
00148 };
00149 
00150 struct prefetch_buffer_t {
00151   md_paddr_t addr;
00152   struct prefetch_buffer_t * next;
00153 };
00154 
00155 struct prefetch_filter_t {
00156   char * table;
00157   int num_entries;
00158   int mask;
00159   int reset_interval;
00160   tick_t last_reset;
00161 };
00162 
00163 struct bus_t {
00164   char * name;
00165   int width; /* in bytes tranferrable per cycle */
00166   int ratio; /* number of cpu cycles per bus cycle */
00167   tick_t when_available;
00168 
00169   struct {
00170     counter_t accesses;
00171     counter_t utilization; /* cumulative cycles in use */
00172     counter_t prefetch_utilization; /* cumulative prefetch cycles in use */
00173   } stat;
00174 };
00175 
00176 struct cache_t {
00177 
00178   struct core_t * core; /* to which core does this belong? NULL = shared */
00179   struct uncore_t *uncore; /* to which uncore this belong? only if shared NULL = Private*/
00180 
00181   char * name;
00182   enum read_only_t read_only;
00183   bool frozen;
00184 
00185   int sets;
00186   int assoc;
00187   int log2_assoc; /* rounded up */
00188 
00189   int linesize;
00190   int addr_shift; /* to mask out the block offset */
00191 
00192   struct cache_line_t ** blocks;
00193 
00194   enum repl_policy_t replacement_policy;
00195   enum alloc_policy_t allocate_policy;
00196   enum write_policy_t write_policy;
00197 
00198   int banks;
00199   int bank_width; /* number of bytes read from a bank */
00200   int bank_shift;
00201   md_paddr_t bank_mask;
00202 
00203   const int begin_index;/* In case a shared cache what chunk lies with this cache*/
00204   const int end_index;
00205 
00206 
00207   int latency;
00208   int heap_size; /* for access event-Q heap */
00209   bool write_combining;
00210   struct cache_action_t ** pipe;    /* access pipeline for regular reads/writes */
00211   int * pipe_num; /* number of requests present in each bank */
00212 
00213   struct cache_fill_t ** fill_pipe; /* pipeline used to fill the cache from higher levels; one per bank */
00214   int * fill_num; /* number of fill requests present in each bank */
00215 
00216   /* miss status handling registers */
00217   int MSHR_banks; /* num MSHR banks */
00218   int MSHR_mask;
00219   int MSHR_size;
00220   enum cache_command * MSHR_cmd_order;
00221   int * MSHR_num; /* num MSHR entries occupied */
00222   int * MSHR_num_pf; /* num MSHR entries occupied by prefetch requests (from this level) */
00223   int * MSHR_fill_num; /* num MSHR entries pending to fill current level */
00224   int * MSHR_unprocessed_num; /* outstanding requests still waiting to go to next level */
00225   struct cache_action_t ** MSHR;
00226   int start_point;
00227 
00228   /* write-back buffers (only for write-back caches) - these are banked if MSHR is banked */
00229   int WBB_size;
00230   int * WBB_num;
00231   int * WBB_head;
00232   int * WBB_tail;
00233   struct cache_line_t ** WBB;
00234 
00235   /* prefetch FIFO */
00236   int PFF_size; /* PFB = PreFetch FIFO */
00237   int PFF_num;
00238   int PFF_head;
00239   int PFF_tail;
00240   struct PFF_t {
00241     md_addr_t PC;
00242     md_paddr_t addr;
00243     struct core_t * core;
00244   } * PFF;
00245 
00246   struct prefetch_t ** prefetcher;
00247   int num_prefetchers;
00248   /* prefetch control */
00249   int prefetch_threshold; /* only perform prefetch if MSHR occupancy is less than this threshold */
00250   int prefetch_max; /* max number of prefetch requests in MSHRs (from this level) */
00251   bool prefetch_on_miss; /* if true, prefetches only generated from miss traffic; else from all accesses */
00252 
00253   enum PF_state_t PF_state;
00254   int PF_last_sample; /* cumulative uncore utilization at last sample point */
00255   int PF_sample_interval;
00256   double PF_low_watermark;  /* {0.0 ... 1.0} */
00257   double PF_high_watermark; /* {0.0 ... 1.0} */
00258 
00259   struct prefetch_buffer_t * PF_buffer;
00260   int PF_buffer_size; /* num entries */
00261   struct prefetch_filter_t * PF_filter;
00262 
00263   /* to next level (toward main memory), e.g., DL1's next-level points to the LLC */
00264   struct cache_t * next_level;
00265   struct bus_t * next_bus;
00266 
00267   /* flags to indicate when there's nothing for the cache to do; helps
00268      speed up simulation */
00269   bool check_for_work;
00270   bool check_for_MSHR_fill_work;
00271   bool check_for_fill_work;
00272   bool check_for_pipe_work;
00273   bool check_for_MSHR_work;
00274   bool check_for_WBB_work;
00275 
00276   struct {
00277     counter_t load_lookups;
00278     counter_t load_misses;
00279     counter_t store_lookups;
00280     counter_t store_misses;
00281     counter_t writeback_lookups;
00282     counter_t writeback_misses;
00283     counter_t prefetch_lookups;
00284     counter_t prefetch_misses;
00285     counter_t prefetch_insertions;
00286     counter_t prefetch_useful_insertions;
00287     counter_t MSHR_occupancy; /* total occupancy */
00288     counter_t MSHR_full_cycles; /* number of cycles when full */
00289     counter_t WBB_insertions; /* total writebacks */
00290     counter_t WBB_victim_insertions; /* total non-dirty insertions */
00291     counter_t WBB_combines; /* number eliminated due to write combining */
00292     counter_t WBB_occupancy; /* total occupancy */
00293     counter_t WBB_full_cycles; /* number of cycles when full */
00294     counter_t WBB_hits;
00295     counter_t WBB_victim_hits;
00296     counter_t *core_lookups;
00297     counter_t *core_misses;
00298     counter_t MSHR_combos;
00299     counter_t uncore_utilization;/*This is only valid for the last level cache It is a measure of the traffic that is enqueued into the controller*/
00300   } stat;
00301 };

00482 /* since these cache functions cannot directly set the core->oracle.hosed
00483    bit, they just return and depend on the rest of the core state getting
00484    hosed to force a reset. */
00485 #ifndef cache_fatal
00486 #ifdef DEBUG
00487 #define cache_fatal(msg, retval) fatal(msg)
00488 #else
00489 #define cache_fatal(msg, retval) { \
00490   fprintf(stderr,"fatal (%s,%d:%s): ",__FILE__,__LINE__,cp->name); \
00491   fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",msg); \
00492   return (retval); \
00493 }
00494 #endif
00495 #endif
00496 
00497 #ifndef cache_assert
00498 #ifdef DEBUG
00499 #define cache_assert(cond, retval) assert(cond)
00500 #else
00501 #define cache_assert(cond, retval) { \
00502   if(!(cond)) { \
00503     fprintf(stderr,"assertion failed (%s,%d:%s): ",__FILE__,__LINE__,cp->name); \
00504     fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",#cond); \
00505     return (retval); \
00506   } \
00507 }
00508 #endif
00509 #endif
